comments:
On Linux Power PC machine, eclipse fails to launch with the log entry below. 
You must start eclipse with -Dosgi.locking =none.  I have mentioned this in the
download clickthrough, however, it should be fixed because setting any VM args
on the command line wipes out any default VM args set by eclipse.

!SESSION 2005-04-29 14:09:53.103 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20050426-1700
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.4.2 IBM build cxppc32142sr1a-20050209 (JIT enabled: jitc)
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=ppc, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -showlocation
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch ppc -showlocation -debug

We cannot fix the problem with locking itself. This is usually caused by a bad
NFS configuration. Running Eclipse on this machine having configuration area (or
install) and workspace locally should work, otherwise it would prove it to be a
VM limitation.

The best we can do is if it is a OS/platform specific problem, then that drop's
eclipse.ini could have locking disabled by default.

Just as another data point...

I did not need this command line arg to launch Eclipse on my box (SLES 9 SP1). 
I am not using NFS.

There is not much we can do about the locking problem, and the command line is
expected to override default options set by eclipse.ini.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 44735 ***
